thread.title: Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley to Mets' Ruben Tejada: Sorry I broke your leg
thread.title_full: Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley to Mets' Ruben Tejada: Sorry I broke your leg

author: Brendan Kuty | NJ Advance Media for NJ.com
title: Los Angeles Dodgers' Chase Utley to Mets' Ruben Tejada: Sorry I broke your leg
text:
Los Angeles Dodgers second baseman Chase Utley apologized to Mets shortstop Ruben Tejada for the collision that broke his leg in New York's 5-2 loss in the National League Division Series on Saturday night , according to Fox Sports' Ken Rosenthal. 
Utley, who didn't mean to hurt Tejada, apologized to him through a friend of his on the Mets, Rosenthal said. 
PLUS: Last time Chase Utley took out Mets' Ruben Tejada, Carlos Beltran was upset 
Tejada, who broke his right fibula, was carted off the field and won't return this season. 
The play helped the Dodgers tie the game at 2-all as Kike Hernandez scored. It started with Howie Kendrick's grounder, which Daniel Murphy fielded behind second base and then toss to Tejada, who caught the ball with his back to first base while turning to attempt a double play. 
Utley slid under him and late. 
The series is tied, 1-1, and will resume in Queens Monday. Char Utley just murdered Ruben Tejada pic.twitter.com/Uyyn21gYaP â€” Kyle Scott (@CrossingBroad) October 11, 2015 #Dodgers ' Utley sent an apology to Tejada last night through a player on the #Mets that he knows well. Intent was not to injure.
